examples: nonlinguistic vocal effects like laughs and sobs

adjective.description: (of music) consisting of or incorporating singing.
Expressing opinions or feelings freely or loudly.
examples: he was vocal in condemning the action

noun.description: A part of a piece of music that is sung.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin vocalis, from vox, voc- (see voice). Current senses of the noun date from the 1920s.
